channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Putin Confidant Who Pushed Back Against Russia’s War in Ukraine
item.description: Dmitri N. Kozak had worked with President Vladimir V. Putin for three decades before quitting in September. His associates described his break with th...

item.title: Australia Mourns the Youngest Victim of the Bondi Beach Shooting
item.description: Sydney’s devastated Jewish community gathered for the funeral of “Matilda Bee,” an ebullient, smiling 10-year-old girl.

item.title: A federal investigation is underway after Nevada’s safety regulator suddenly dropped violations against Boring Company
item.description: Lawyers and regulators say the Nevada state agency’s handling of the safety investigation went against procedure.

item.title: Elon Musk says there will be ‘no poverty’ in the future, implying Ray Dalio’s multi-million Trump Account pledge will be essentially redundant
item.description: "It is certainly a nice gesture," Musk said. "But there will be no poverty in the future and so no need to save money."

item.title: European Leaders Face Off Over Whether to Unlock Russian Frozen Assets for Ukraine
item.description: The European Council convenes on Thursday, and at stake is a contentious deal to back Ukraine and its war effort. The final decision is a major test o...

item.title: A Bellicose Trump Points Fingers in Defending His Record on the Economy
item.description: In an 18-minute address, President Trump said the economy was booming despite the public’s consistent concerns about prices. Here are six takeaways fr...

item.title: Rivian CEO says midprice EV sales are still 50% Tesla: ‘That’s not a reflection of a healthy market’
item.description: Lackluster demand for electric cars in the U.S. isn’t because Americans don’t want them, RJ Scaringe said. There’s just few good options.

item.title: Exclusive: Swedish startup automating mechanical, electrical, and plumbing design for commercial buildings raises $20 million in seed round
item.description: Endra says it can reduce the time needed to design electrical systems from months to hours.

item.title: ‘Big Short’ investor Michael Burry piles misery onto tech stocks after Oracle fails to close AI debt deal
item.description: Of course, Burry has a conflict of interest in the form of a $1.1 billion short bet against AI stocks. So take his doom-mongering with a pinch of salt...

item.title: Pope Leo Appoints Bishop Ronald Hicks to Succeed Timothy Dolan
item.description: The appointment of Bishop Ronald A. Hicks is expected to bring a markedly different leadership style to New York’s archdiocese.

item.title: European Leaders Face Off Over Whether to Unlock Russian Frozen Assets for Ukraine
item.description: The European Council convenes on Thursday, and at stake is a contentious deal to back Ukraine and its war effort. The final decision is a major test o...

item.description: Dmitri N. Kozak had worked with President Vladimir V. Putin for three decades before quitting in September. His associates described his break with th...

item.title: Two U.K. Police Forces Pledge to Arrest People Who Chant ‘Globalize the Intifada’
item.description: The police in London and Manchester said they would take a “more assertive” approach after the Bondi Beach massacre and a terrorist attack at a Britis...

item.title: The Secret Trial of the General Who Refused to Attack Tiananmen Square
item.description: In 1989, Gen. Xu Qinxian defied orders to crush the pro-democracy protests in Beijing. Now, leaked video from his court-martial is on YouTube.
